tftp

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • tftp.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Exitable

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements Exitable
    Implementation of the TFTP file transfer program on client side.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client()
      Constructor for Client class, initialize a new socket upon called.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Constructor for Client class, initialize a new socket upon called.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(java.net.InetAddress addr,
                  java.lang.String filename,
                  java.lang.String mode)
        This method implement the writing process on the client side during the TFTP file transfer. A valid write process will take place given a valid IP address, a file location, and a transfer mode.
        Parameters:
        addr - IP address of the packet being sent
        filename - String representation of the file and directory that is related to the write request
        mode - Mode of the transfer i.e Netascii, octet, etc.

      • read

        public void read(java.net.InetAddress addr,
                 java.lang.String filename,
                 java.lang.String mode)
        This method implement the reading process on the client side during the TFTP file transfer. A valid read process will take place given a valid IP address, a file location, and a transfer mode.
        Parameters:
        addr - IP address of the packet being sent
        filename - String representation of the file and directory that is related to the write request
        mode - Mode of the transfer i.e Netascii, octet, etc.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method will be invoked once a client program is executed. It will prompt the user for inputs for file transfer process and handle the request based on the arguments given.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        A safe exit approach from the client side.
        Specified by:
        exit in interface Exitable

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of client class.
        Parameters:
        args - input arguments when execute the server
